lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ibK qnk hI Kwq mir jwiq qwq gwiq murJwq pRiqpwlI brKn kI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Bikh Tanak Hee Khaat Mari Jaati Taata , Gaati Murajhaat Pratipaalee Barakhan Kee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as by taking a very small quantity of poison, one dies instantly, destroying the body that had been reared and sustained over many years.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy koit Bwir qUil rMck icng pry hoq Bsmwq iCn mY AkrKn kI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Koti Bhaari Tooli Ranchak Chinag Paray , Hot Bhasamaat Chhin Mai Akarakhan Kee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a can of milk of buffalo contaminated with a drop of citric acid becomes useless and not worth keeping.

lines.gurmukhi: mihKI duhwie dUD rwKIAY BwNjn Bir priq kwNjI kI bUMd bwid n rKn kI
lines.transliteration_english: Mahikhee Duhaai Doodh Raakheeai Bhaanjan Bhari , Parati Kaanjee Kee Boond Baadi N Rakhan Kee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a spark of fire can burn millions of bales of cotton in a short time.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy pr qn Dn dUKnw ibkwr kIey hrY iniD sukRq shj hrKn kI ]506]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Par Tan Dhan Dookhanaa Bikaar Keeay , Harai Nidhi Soukrat Sahaj Harakhan Kee ?506?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the vices and sins that one acquires by associating oneself with other's wealth and beauty, one loses the much valuable commodity of happiness, good deeds and peace.  (506)
